name: Factory manager (board game)

description:
-- MAXIMUM 10 PEOPLE PLEASE --

Only 10 places; 11 and later will be on the waiting list.

 

Game 1) Power Grid, 2-6 players

http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/2651/power-grid

 

Game 2) Timbuktu, a game for 3 - 5 players.
In this game each players take the role of a caravan leader. The number of camels within a caravan depends on he number of players. Each camel is loaded with a lot of goods, and the goal of the game is to carry all the goods from the starting position to the final oasis: Timbuktu.

However, during the course of this journey, the caravans stop at other oases. Once all camels arrive to an oasis- and the night comes- thieves attack the caravan, and stole different goods. While moving from one oasis to another, players receive different clues about the manner of the thefts. Each player has a different clue, and although clues are passed around, one player only receives three of the total five clues. From the action of the other players – caravan leaders -, the clues have to be guessed and camels have to be relocated in order to save all the goods from the thieves.

The next morning the caravan continues its way towards Timbuktu, and players are challenged with different clues again. The object of the game is to be the trader left with the most value in goods when you reach Timbuktu.

Description taken from this website:
http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/691/timbuktu
name: Play Timbuktu and Power Grid

description:
Tonight's videogaming night and here's the recipe:

Ingredients (in brackets what is still needed):

- TV

- Wii

- Snacks and drinks (please bring these)

- 2 Wii controllers (please bring extra?)

- 2 Game Cube controllers

- Games: Mario Kart for Wii and GC, Boomblocks Party, Mario Party for GC.

- No nunchucks (anyone got these?)

 

I can host, but someone else can host as well. It would be easier if you have a Wii and a TV. Any volunteers?

name: Boardgames @ Cindy

description:
What: Belgium board game convention

Where: Ranst (http://goo.gl/maps/FQsZj) 

How do we get there: by public transport (that is plan A, unless someone can transport people by car and we can split fuel).

- Meet at 9:15 AM at Brussels-Midi and take the train to Antwerp (8 euro, weekend return ticket)
- Take the bus from Antwerp to Ranst (approx. 40 min.) (no idea how much this is; have to check this out)

What does it cost me: Entrance fee (3 euro) and transport (around 10-12 euro max.)

Why should you go: Personally, it's one of my favorite board game conventions, because it's not too big and not too crowded. Also, usually you can buy board games for a very good price. The newest board games might not be there, but there are many board games to try out. Also, if you're into visiting towns in Belgium, you can tick Ranst off your list ;).

Website: http://spel.forumfederatie.be/index.html


Optional: Since we have to travel via Antwerp, it might be a nice excuse to go for some food at Wagamama (Japanese ramen) afterwards :).
name: Spel 2013: Belgium board game convention

description:
Background story (skip this if you are in a hurry)

Some of you might know the Sinterklaas tradition. I will not bore you with all the details, but basically there is this guy that supposedly comes from Spain and each year brings gifts to children that behave well. (If you don't behave well - they put you in a bag and take you to Spain).

Regardless of the story behind it, I always like this holiday, because it's an opportunity to come together in combination with a gift giving tradition.

The adult version in the Netherlands goes usually like this. You bring together a group of people and you write on a piece of paper your name and what you would like to have. You then shuffle the basket, and every one picks one piece of paper (you have to redraw if you pick yourself).

Then, you have a couple weeks to make a suprise (we pronounce it differently 'supreezuh') usually from papier-mache (some examples can be found here:

https://www.google.be/search?q=sinterklaas+surprise&client=firefox-a&hs=uC4&rls=org.mozilla:nl:official&channel=fflb&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ei=l14-VIGABufN7Qaax4GoDA&ved=0CAgQ_AUoAQ&biw=1055&bih=739

), in which you hide the present. Usually people also write poems to accompany this present, these poems are usually about the person receiving the gift. On Sinterklaasavond (around 5th of December) you come together, have a night full of Sinterklaas candy and gift each other thesesuprises.

Sinterklaas party

For the Sinterklaas party we will only do the gift giving part (but you can make a poem - if you want).

1) Sign up and bring a one or multiple wrapped gift(s) with total value of about 5 euro.

2) We will play a game with dice to decide who gets which present. It is possible you will go home with multiple present, or with none.


I'll provide drinks and Sinterklaas-snacks :).
name: Sinterklaas party
